answers.answer: Ive only had 1 and it was in 2013 but..I was able to skin to skin with my daughter in recovery and my husband was allowed in recovery with us. And I had dissolving stitches, not actual stitches the dr had to remove after 6 weeks. Ive heard these were different from a family memeber who had a csection 6yrs ago but it may have been different for you. Good luck to you! I will have my 2nd csection in Nov!
I had my c-section 14 yrs ago, I wonder the same. I hear a lot of changes have occurred.

I had mine in 2013 as well and it was similar to afm_cam. I also had my husband hold my hand while they did the spinal, the spinal wore off after 4hrs and I ate dinner, the next day they took my cathetar out and I was free to walk around and do whatever I wanted during my stay which was great as the walks to nicu and the cafe really helped my recovery by the time I got home. I'm going for my 2nd csection later this year. Good luck!

Im really nervous this time around mainly because it has been so long i don't know what to expect i never got to do skin to skin with either of mine that would be nice but they did do the stitches that dissolves  because i asked for them my last c sections wasn't exactly great(bad docs.) This time i went to a different doc.

Ohhh yes, I was discharged 36hrs after surgery. I was up walking around the next day and it really helped recovery too. I think the spinal tap was the only iffy part for me as I didnt know what exactly to expect besides the actual surgery. I loved being coherent through it all though and my husband got awesome pictures, with the drs permission. We got a picture of her in the sac after she was pulled out! Amazing but gruesome I know but still amazing!

That is so cool afm_cam! I think my husband would have freaked at that. He got to go behind the sheet and cut the cord and he said he tried so hard not to look but caught a glimpse of the actual surgery and can't forget it! Lol. The nurse took some lovely photos of us having first cuddles tho which was great.

Lol, that epic family pic that the nurse took in the operating room was an epic FAIL for us..it was a great pic of my hubby and daughter but you see me in the background looking like a weirdo! I was shocked that my hubby didnt pass out but I think he held up his phone over the curtain and snapped the pictures without looking to closely lol!

Im hoping this time will be better as i said i had bad docs last time and i wanted to get up and move because i knew i would feel better but they was trying to keep me in the bed i had to actually argue with the nurse to let me walk around finally she said the doctor said i could get up if i could walk to the bathroom on my own  i did that then they finally let me up and my diner after not eating for 36 hours was chicken broth and jello the surgery wasn't bad but the recovery was because they wouldnt let me get better sounds like things have changed

My sister had an emergency csection and was not coherent for the first day..but they MADE her get out of bed the next day to use the bathroom and walk around. She had a surplus of meds going through her, she was on the verge of preeclampsia. Her blood pressure skyrocketed and baby was distressed and thats when a csection was called. Anyways, she was like a zombie and when the meds finally wore off, the nurses were encouraging her to get up. @Csections, is there a way you could tour the facility that you will be at? I found that helped with my anxiety as I knew the procedures. (I.e. floor for delivery, floor for recovery, nursery, nurses station, and everything in between) Maybe if thats an option, you could ask questions about their surgery policy and procedures. I think knowing beforehand makes the experience better as you're not worrying about what happens next, IMO.

question: I know this is a crazy question i have had 2 c section and I'm having another in 2 weeks the problem is my last one was 7 years ago has anyone had one recently and also one along time ago was there a difference between the two?
title: has c sections changed?
